intro: Stillingia yungasensis, commonly known as the Yungas stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the Yungas region of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers and is often found in moist, forested areas. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
